intro: Parasenecio hayachinensis, commonly known as the Japanese parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in a disc-like arrangement. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
